sentence2: Thanks to our generous donations, we were able to invite Beyonce to throw a concert for the Indianapolis orphans.
sentence2_translated: A tún rí owó tá a fi ṣètọrẹ, a sì ní àǹfààní láti pe Beyoncé láti ṣe ìṣe fún àwọn ọmọ òrukàn tó wà ní ìlú Indianapolis.

sentence2: We had hoped to throw a Christmas party to the children, but we've never been able to do anything for them.
sentence2_translated: A ti ń retí pé a máa ṣe àsè Kérésì fún àwọn ọmọ náà, àmọ́ a ò lè ṣe ohunkóhun fún wọn.

sentence2: We were able to help many Indianapolis children.
sentence2_translated: A rí i pé a lè ran ọ̀pọ̀ ọmọ ìlú Indianapolis lọ́wọ́.

sentence2: Individuals can participate after making a small $50 donation.
sentence2_translated: Àwọn tó bá fẹ́ kópa nínú ètò yìí lè kópa nínú rẹ̀ lẹ́yìn tí wọ́n bá ti fi ìṣúra kékeré kan tó tó ọgọ́ta [50] dọ́là ṣètọrẹ.

sentence2: Individuals can participate if they make a large enough donation.
sentence2_translated: Àwọn èèyàn lè kópa nínú ètò náà bí wọ́n bá ṣe ọrẹ tó pọ̀ tó.

sentence2: Most of the individuals prefer to donate to Chancellors Associates.
sentence2_translated: Ọ̀pọ̀ jù lọ àwọn èèyàn ló máa ń fún àwọn ọ̀gá àgbà ní ẹ̀bùn.

sentence2: Our pediatric physicians are investigating a variety of diseases.
sentence2_translated: Àwọn dókítà wa ń ṣèwádìí nípa onírúurú àrùn.

sentence2: We fired our pediatricians last year, due to their laziness.
sentence2_translated: A yọ àwọn dókítà ọmọdé wa lẹ́nu lọ́dún tó kọjá, nítorí ìwà ọ̀lẹ̀ wọn.

sentence2: We hope to cure childhood cancer in the next few years, thanks to the hard work of our pediatric physicians.
sentence2_translated: A nírètí pé a óò mú àrùn jẹjẹrẹ ọmọdé kúrò láàárín ọdún mélòó kan tó ń bọ̀, a ó sì ṣe é pẹ̀lú ìsapá àwọn dókítà ọmọdé wa.

sentence2: If you make a gift of at least $1,000, you'll be able to receive tax benefits for sure.
sentence2_translated: Tó o bá fi ẹgbẹ̀rún kan dọ́là ṣètọrẹ, wàá lè rí owó orí gbà.

sentence2: Unfortunately, our tax advisors would advise you not to make any gifts.
sentence2_translated: Ó ṣeni láàánú pé àwọn olùrànlọ́wọ́ wa lórí owó orí máa ń gbà ẹ́ nímọ̀ràn pé kó o má ṣe fúnni ní ẹ̀bùn kankan.

sentence2: You might be able to take tax deductions on your donations.
sentence2_translated: O lè gba ìnáwó orí lórí ọrẹ rẹ.

sentence2: Some of this group's members have donated over $100k to the school.
sentence2_translated: Àwọn kan lára àwọn tó wà nínú àwùjọ yìí ti fi ohun tó lé ní $ 100,000 ṣètọrẹ fún iléèwé náà.

sentence2: We have people in this group who have contributed over $1,000 to the law school.
sentence2_translated: Àwọn èèyàn tó wà nínú àwùjọ yìí ti fún ilé ẹ̀kọ́ òfin ní ohun tó lé ní ẹgbẹ̀rún kan dọ́là.

sentence2: We plan to ask this group to make monetary contributions to the school, but never have before.
sentence2_translated: A ní láti béèrè lọ́wọ́ àwùjọ yìí pé kí wọ́n ṣe ọrẹ owó sí iléèwé náà, àmọ́ kò tíì rí bẹ́ẹ̀ rí.

sentence2: I hated going to theater shows as a kid, so that's why I became a scientist.
sentence2_translated: Mo kórìíra lílọ sí àwọn eré tí mo ń ṣe nígbà tí mo wà lọ́mọdé, torí náà mo di onímọ̀ sáyẹ́ǹsì.

sentence2: I loved going to the theater when I was a kid.
sentence2_translated: Mo fẹ́ràn láti lọ sí ilé ìṣeré nígbà tí mo wà lọ́mọdé.

sentence2: My favorite Civic Theatre production was Beauty and the Beast.
sentence2_translated: Ohun tí mo fẹ́ràn jù lọ nínú eré ìtàgé ìlú ni "Ojúdébìnrin àti ẹranko".

sentence2: Everyone who receives this letter: don't donate your money, it's a scam.
sentence2_translated: Gbogbo ẹni tó bá gba lẹ́tà yìí: má ṣe fi owó rẹ ṣètọrẹ, ó jẹ́ àdàkàdekè.

sentence2: If you donate $18, we will give you a gift.
sentence2_translated: Tó o bá fún wa ní dọ́là méjìdínlógún, a máa fún ẹ ní ẹ̀bùn.

sentence2: We hope all letter recipients can donate $18.
sentence2_translated: A nírètí pé gbogbo àwọn tó bá gba lẹ́tà náà lè fi $18.00 ṣètọrẹ.

sentence2: Please do not make any changes to your address.
sentence2_translated: Jọ̀wọ́ má ṣe yí àdírẹ́sì rẹ padà.

sentence2: There is a white envelope enclosed, with your address on it.
sentence2_translated: Àkájọ ìwé funfun kan wà tó wà níbẹ̀, ó sì fi àdírẹ́sì rẹ hàn.

sentence2: You are free to make changes to your address, if you see fit.
sentence2_translated: O lè yí àdírẹ́sì rẹ padà, tó o bá rí i pé ó yẹ.

sentence2: We are hoping to surpass our goal of $200,000 but we need your help to do so.
sentence2_translated: A ń retí pé a ó ju ohun tá a fẹ́ ṣe lọ ní $200,000 lọ, àmọ́ a nílò ìrànlọ́wọ́ yín láti ṣe èyí.

sentence2: We have reached our goal, going over $17,380!, thanks to people like yourself making donations.
sentence2_translated: A ti ṣe ohun tá a fẹ́ ṣe, a ti lé ní ẹgbẹ̀rún mẹ́tàdínlógún ó lé ẹgbẹ̀rún mẹ́tàdínlógójì [17,380] dọ́là!

sentence2: We need at least $200,000 from people just like you.
sentence2_translated: Ó kéré tán, a nílò $200,000 láti ọ̀dọ̀ àwọn èèyàn bíi tìẹ.

sentence2: Please donate $100 million to the School of Nursing, or you will lose your commemorative statue.
sentence2_translated: Jọ̀wọ́ fún iléèwé àwọn adùn ní mílíọ̀nù kan dọ́là, tàbí kó o pàdánù ère ìrántí rẹ.

sentence2: The School of Nursing met all its financial goals, so it does not need any more money.
sentence2_translated: Ilé Ẹ̀kọ́ Àwọn Obìnrin Olùtọ́jú Tó Ń Ṣọ́jú Tọ́jú Àwọn Ọmọdé ti ṣe gbogbo ohun tó fẹ́, torí náà kò nílò owó kankan mọ́.

sentence2: We hope you will donate to the School of Nursing.
sentence2_translated: A nírètí pé wàá ṣètọrẹ sí Ilé Ẹ̀kọ́ Àwọn Obìnrin Olùtọ́jú.

sentence2: More than half the participants will report increased conflict resolution skills.
sentence2_translated: Ó lé ní ìdajì àwọn tó kópa nínú ìwádìí náà ló sọ pé àwọn ní àwọn òye tó pọ̀ sí i nípa lílépa àwọn ìṣòro.

sentence2: Only a quarter of participants will report increased conflict resolution skills.
sentence2_translated: Ìkẹta péré lára àwọn tó ń kópa nínú ìwádìí náà ló sọ pé àwọn ní àwọn òye tó pọ̀ sí i nípa lílépa àwọn ìṣòro.

sentence2: There were over 100 individual participants.
sentence2_translated: Àwọn tó kópa nínú ìkẹ́kọ̀ọ́ náà lé ní ọgọ́rùn-ún.

sentence2: It would be a shame if you stopped donating.
sentence2_translated: Ó máa dùn mí gan-an bí o bá jáwọ́ nínú fífúnni.

sentence2: Our lapsed donor list is published for the world to see, so trust me, you don't want to be shamed like that!
sentence2_translated: A ti tẹ àkọsílẹ̀ àwọn olùpèsè tí kò sí láàyè jáde fún gbogbo ayé láti rí, nítorí náà, fọkàn tán mi, o ò ní fẹ́ kí ojú tì ẹ lọ́nà yẹn!

sentence2: We have too many donors, so please stop donating.
sentence2_translated: A ní ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ àwọn tó ń fúnni níṣìírí, nítorí náà, jọ̀wọ́, má ṣe fúnni níṣìírí mọ́.

sentence2: People don't need anything for grounds access.
sentence2_translated: Àwọn èèyàn ò nílò ohunkóhun láti wọlé sí àgbègbè náà.

sentence2: People need both a computer and a modem to enter the grounds.
sentence2_translated: Àwọn èèyàn nílò kọ̀ǹpútà àti mọ́dẹ́mù láti wọlé.

sentence2: People need to carry their computer and modem with them while entering the grounds, in order to have access.
sentence2_translated: Àwọn èèyàn gbọ́dọ̀ gbé kọ̀ǹpútà wọn àti módẹ́mù wọn lọ nígbà tí wọ́n bá ń wọlé, kí wọ́n lè wọlé.

sentence2: If you choose to sponsor an American Indian child you will not be allowed to participate in Futures for Children.
sentence2_translated: Tó o bá yàn láti gba ọmọ Íńdíà kan nípò àṣẹ, a ò ní gbà ọ́ láyè láti kópa nínú ètò "Ìjọ́ iwájú fún Àwọn Ọmọdé".

sentence2: If you sponsor an American Indian child you would be participating in Future for Children.
sentence2_translated: Tó o bá ń dá ọmọ ilẹ̀ Íńdíà kan lẹ́yìn, wàá máa kópa nínú ètò Future for Children.

sentence2: You can participate in Futures for Children by choosing to sponsor an American Indian child and send them to school.
sentence2_translated: O lè kópa nínú Future for Children nípa fífi yan láti ṣètìlẹ́yìn fún ọmọ Íńdíà kan tó wá láti Amẹ́ríkà kó o sì rán an lọ sí ilé ìwé.

sentence2: There was an unanimous vote for your appointment as Charter Associate of the Center on Philanthropy.
sentence2_translated: Gbogbo èèyàn ló fọwọ́ sí i pé kó o di ọ̀kan lára àwọn tó ń ṣojú fún Àjọ Tó Ń Rí sí Ìdáa.

sentence2: We decided that you cannot be a Charter Associate of the Center on Philanthropy.
sentence2_translated: A pinnu pé o ò lè di òǹkàwé àjọ tó ń ṣètò àwọn èèyàn.

sentence2: We invite you to be a part of the Center on Philanthropy.
sentence2_translated: A pè ẹ́ láti dara pọ̀ mọ́ Àjọ Tó Ń Rí sí Ìdáa.

sentence2: As long as we have ticket sales our entire season is financed.
sentence2_translated: Níwọ̀n ìgbà tá a bá ti ń ta àwọn títì, a máa ń sanwó fún gbogbo ìgbà tá a bá wà ní ìdajì ọdún wa.

sentence2: Our complete season needs more to finance it then just ticket sales and subscriptions.
sentence2_translated: Ó tún nílò ohun tó pọ̀ jù láti fi owó náà ra nǹkan ju tààràtà àti ìforúkọsílẹ̀ lọ.

sentence2: TIcket sales and subscriptions only cover 70% of the financing costs for our complete season.
sentence2_translated: Àwọn ìsọfúnni nípa ìsọfúnni tó wà nínú ìwé ìsọfúnni yìí máa ń jẹ́ ká rí i pé àwọn ìsọfúnni tó wà nínú ìwé ìsọfúnni náà kò ní jẹ́ ká mọ ohun tó ń ṣẹlẹ̀.

sentence2: Only half of the law school's computers are still functional.
sentence2_translated: Ìdajì pápá pápá pápá ni kọ̀ǹpútà ilé ẹ̀kọ́ òfin ṣì ń ṣiṣẹ́.

sentence2: The law school has computers, as well as a library.
sentence2_translated: Ilé ẹ̀kọ́ òfin ní kọ̀ǹpútà, àti ilé ìkówèésí.

sentence2: The law school is paper-based, and computers and other digital technology are forbidden.
sentence2_translated: Ilé ẹ̀kọ́ òfin náà dá lórí ìwé, kò sì sí kọ̀ǹpútà àti àwọn nǹkan míì tó ń jẹ́ ẹ̀rọ alágbèéká.

sentence2: Every gift is recorded and announced in our monthly journal.
sentence2_translated: A máa ń kọ gbogbo ẹ̀bùn wa sílẹ̀, a sì máa ń kéde rẹ̀ nínú ìwé ìròyìn wa.

sentence2: Every gift offered counts towards something.
sentence2_translated: Ohun kan ló ń ṣe gbogbo ẹ̀bùn tá a fúnni.

sentence2: Only gifts above $100 make a difference.
sentence2_translated: Àwọn ẹ̀bùn tó ju ọgọ́rùn-ún dọ́là lọ ló máa ń mú kí nǹkan yí pa dà.

sentence2: Our monetary goal exceeds $300,000.
sentence2_translated: Ohun tá à ń lépa jù lọ ni pé ká máa náwó tó tó ọ̀kẹ́ mẹ́ta [300,000] dọ́là.

sentence2: We are actually hoping to triple our monetary goal.
sentence2_translated: A nírètí pé a ó tún gbé ìfojúsùn wa nípa owó lọ́nà mẹ́ta.

sentence2: We don't have any benchmarks in regards to money.
sentence2_translated: A ò ní ìlànà kankan nípa owó.

sentence2: Our Civil Practice Clinic has operated for eight years.
sentence2_translated: Ó ti lé ní ọdún mẹ́jọ tí ilé ìwòsàn wa ti ń ṣiṣẹ́.

sentence2: Our Civil Practice Clinic is celebrating its first full year in operation next month.
sentence2_translated: Ilé ìwòsàn wa tó ń bójú tó ọ̀ràn ìṣègùn yóò ṣe ayẹyẹ ọdún àkọ́kọ́ tó ti bẹ̀rẹ̀ iṣẹ́ lóṣù tó ń bọ̀.

sentence2: The Civil Practice Clinic has been in operation for more than a year.
sentence2_translated: Ilé ìwòsàn tó ń dá àwọn èèyàn lẹ́kọ̀ọ́ ti ń ṣiṣẹ́ fún ọdún kan.

sentence2: It seems that the cost of these programs will not be covered by the ticket income.
sentence2_translated: Ó jọ pé owó tó ń wọlé fún àwọn ètò yìí kò ní fi owó tí wọ́n ń wọlé fún wọn ṣètọrẹ.

sentence2: The cost of these programs is very high.
sentence2_translated: Owó àwọn ètò wọ̀nyí ga gan-an.

sentence2: The ticket income will definitely cover the cost of these programs.
sentence2_translated: Àwọn owó tó ń wọlé fún àwọn títẹ́lì yìí yóò sì máa bo gbogbo owó tó ń wọlé fún àwọn ètò yìí.

sentence2: Every member of the National Audubon Society receives free dinner vouchers.
sentence2_translated: Gbogbo àwọn tó wà nínú Ẹgbẹ́ Audubon National gba ìwé ìléwó oúnjẹ ọ̀sán lọ́fẹ̀ẹ́.

sentence2: The National Audubon Society provides its members with multiple benefits.
sentence2_translated: Àjọ Audubon ti Orílẹ̀-Èdè ń fún àwọn ọmọ ìjọ rẹ̀ ní onírúurú àǹfààní.

sentence2: There is absolutely no benefit to being a member of the National Audubon Society.
sentence2_translated: Kò sí àǹfààní kankan rárá láti jẹ́ ọ̀kan lára Ẹgbẹ́ Audubon ti Orílẹ̀-Èdè.

sentence2: If available list organization's name along with full address.
sentence2_translated: Tó bá wà, fi orúkọ àjọ náà àti àdírẹ́sì rẹ̀ kún un.

sentence2: If the organization does not have a name include your first and last name along with address information.
sentence2_translated: Tó bá jẹ́ pé ètò náà kò ní orúkọ, kó o fi orúkọ àti orúkọ ìdílé rẹ àti àdírẹ́sì rẹ kún un.

sentence2: Make up a name for the organization along with a fake address and phone number.
sentence2_translated: Gbé orúkọ àjọ náà sínú, kó o sì fi àdírẹ́sì àti nọ́ńbà tẹlifóònù èké hàn án.

sentence2: Linda Hardwick Chief Executive Officer
sentence2_translated: Linda Hardwick, Olùdarí Ààrẹ

sentence2: Link Harwick, Development
sentence2_translated: Àjọṣepọ Harwick, Ìdàgbàsókè

sentence2: The Director of Development is Linda Harwick

sentence2: I absolutely despise the IRT.
sentence2_translated: Mo kórìíra IRT pátápátá.

sentence2: I find the IRT favorable.
sentence2_translated: Mo rí i pé ìwádìí nípa àyẹ̀wò ààbò ti ara ẹni ti ṣe dáadáa.

sentence2: I have yet to meet someone who likes the IRT as much as me.
sentence2_translated: Mi ò tíì rí ẹnì kan tó fẹ́ràn IRT bíi tèmi.

sentence2: The Society has put zero resources into impacting their future.

sentence2: The Society is primarily looking out for their own long-term benefit.

sentence2: The Society promotes the gaining of knowledge in multiple ways.
sentence2_translated: Àjọ náà ń lo ọ̀pọ̀ ọ̀nà láti mú kí ìmọ̀ gbilẹ̀.

sentence2: Inner Circle members do not receive anything for being a part of the group.
sentence2_translated: Àwọn tó wà nínú Ìpínlẹ̀ Inú kò gba ohunkóhun nítorí pé wọ́n wà nínú àwùjọ náà.

sentence2: Inner Circle members receive various perks.

sentence2: Inner Circle membership is not free.

sentence2: The law school does not employ anyone.
sentence2_translated: Ilé ẹ̀kọ́ òfin kò ní ẹnì kankan.

sentence2: The law school employs at least one person.
sentence2_translated: Ó kéré tán, ẹnì kan ló ń ṣiṣẹ́ ní ilé ẹ̀kọ́ òfin.

sentence2: The law school has a very prestigious label.
sentence2_translated: Ilé ẹ̀kọ́ òfin yìí ní orúkọ oyè tó ga gan-an.

sentence2: The IUPUI is not accepting donations anymore.
sentence2_translated: Ilé Ẹ̀ka Tó Ń Rí sí Ìpínlẹ̀ Àwọn Orílẹ̀-Èdè Ilẹ̀ Amẹ́ríkà kò gba ọrẹ mọ́.

sentence2: The IUPUI needs $1million to operate this year.

sentence2: The IUPUI needs support.

sentence2: Only one person worked on the costume.
sentence2_translated: Ẹni kan ṣoṣo ló ṣiṣẹ́ lórí aṣọ náà.

sentence2: The people who helped make the costume are all women.
sentence2_translated: Àwọn obìnrin ló ran àwọn tó ṣe aṣọ náà lọ́wọ́.

sentence2: Three people contributed to the costume's making.
sentence2_translated: Àwọn èèyàn mẹ́ta ló kópa nínú kíkọ́ aṣọ náà.

sentence2: Making a charitable contribution will benefit you directly.
sentence2_translated: Tó o bá ṣe ọrẹ sí ètò àjọ kan, wàá jàǹfààní gan-an.

sentence2: The code is not readable.

sentence2: There is some advantage to making a charitable contribution.

sentence2: Law schools don't care about the caliber of students, they just want money.
sentence2_translated: Àwọn ilé ẹ̀kọ́ òfin kì í bìkítà nípa bí àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ ṣe máa ń ṣe dáadáa, owó nìkan ni wọ́n fẹ́.

sentence2: Law schools want students with GPAs over 3.9.
sentence2_translated: Àwọn ilé ẹ̀kọ́ òfin fẹ́ kí àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ tó ní GPA tó ju 3,9 lọ.

sentence2: Law schools want the best students.

sentence2: The educators all have Master's Degrees.
sentence2_translated: Gbogbo àwọn olùkọ́ ló ní ìwé àṣẹ.

sentence2: The educators have graduated from some coursework.

sentence2: The educators never got past a high school education.
